issues.description: The problem statement contains a conflicting specification for getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): the textual task (lines 43-45 of the problem statement) instructs students to implement a method that returns a String (format: "LectureName (TotalNumberOfStudents)"), but the UML diagram in the same problem statement declares getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): void (line 71). The solution implementation returns a String (solution Lecture.java lines 80-82), which indicates the UML's void return type is incorrect. This contradiction is likely to confuse students — especially because the text explicitly tells them to “check the expected return type in the UML diagram” — and could lead them to implement the wrong signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the UML diagram in the problem statement to declare getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): String to match the textual description and the solution. Also update the hint that directs students to check the UML for return types so it does not point to an incorrect signature.
